author: The Telegraph
title: Holiday accomodation: apartments across Europe
text: More winter sun destinations» Brittany Ferries has come up with a great selection of apartments that offer fantastic value for an extended winter sun holiday in Spain, Portugal or France. Prices start at just £539pp for four weeks in a well-equipped apartment, including your cruise-ferry crossing from England to Spain or France with your car. On the Costa Blanca, at the delightful small seaside town of Calpe, the stylish Apartamentos Sol y Mar offer space and privacy with the services of the adjoining four-star hotel. There’s a spa, gym and supermarket on the site. The quieter part of the Costa del Sol is where you’ll find the Apartamentos Fuerte Calaceite, near Torrox Costa. These comfy apartments are in a peaceful area with great views and have an outdoor pool that is open in winter. A mini-market and bike hire are on site too. You can find out more about these two Spanish properties here . Prefer Portugal? In the far south-west of the Algarve, there are the Sagres Time Apartamentos in the traditional village of Sagres. The well-equipped apartments – where pets are also welcome – are away from the Algarve’s busier areas yet within a short drive of Lagos and excellent golf courses. If you wish to be closer to the action, the Rocha Brava Village Resort is set above cliffs near the resort of Carvoeiro, a few minutes by car from the estuary town of Portimão. The apartments here enjoy access to four pools (one of which is covered), tennis courts, a gym, supermarket, bar and restaurant. Discover more about these two Portuguese properties here . The French Riviera is easily accessible from the north-western regions of Brittany and Normandy, which are also served by regular Brittany Ferries services. At the pretty village of Le Rayol, the Residence le Bailli de Suffren consists of 19 modern apartments close to renowned botanical gardens. The apartments have simple kitchens – restaurants are close by – and free Wi-Fi. Down the steps there is a lovely sandy cove. Relax and unwind: Apartamentos Fuerte Calaceite, Torrox Costa, near Nerja Other accommodation options And if the above options aren’t tempting enough, here’s a few more from Brittany Ferries’ winter sun property selection… Golfers will adore the Las Lomas Village Apartments at La Manga on the Costa Blanca because they are on the same site as three top-class courses. Stay in one of the townhouses or apartments for 28 days and you’ll receive 30 activity vouchers per apartment, redeemable on golf, the spa, and a choice of other activities. Not far away are the Mar Menor Golf Resort Apartments at Torre Pacheco, next to a Jack Nicklaus-designed course. If you fancy some watersports or birdwatching, the vast lagoon of Mar Menor is a few minutes’ drive away. Just outside the seaside town of Denia, the busy Ona Ogisaka Garden Aparthotel makes a superb base from which to explore the coast and countryside. The apartments surround a lovely pool and there’s a wellbeing centre on site. The beach is just 200 metres away. Those who like a bit of luxury might opt for Parques Casablanca, close to several resorts such as Calpe, Moraira or Denia. The apartments are extremely well furnished, with high-quality appliances. There’s a spa, parking and Wi-Fi, and plenty of bars and restaurants in the area. North of Alicante, near El Campello, the Pueblo Acantilado Suites have been set out in traditional Spanish style overlooking the sea. You’ll benefit from a restaurant, bar, tennis, pool and small spa and the friendly staff will help you make the most of exploring the area. Fuengirola on the Costa del Sol is buzzing with families in summer, but in winter it’s a pleasantly tranquil place. The Club La Costa World townhouses are on an outstanding complex with various restaurants, pools, tennis, gym and entertainment. At chic Marbella, the Crown Resort is the place for those seeking a lively holiday with the privacy of an apartment. You’ll find a heated pool, gym, restaurant and various entertainments. Other places to eat and drink are just a stroll away. On the Algarve, Albufeira is one of the most popular resorts, with an appealing old town and fabulous beaches. Fish restaurants and lively bars are open all year and the town’s central location makes it ideal for exploring or for testing your golfing skills on a huge range of courses. Brittany Ferries offers three properties in Albufeira. Alfagar Village is built in traditional style among gardens on the clifftop overlooking the sea; it’s about three miles from the town but resort facilities are close by. There’s a great bar terrace and a pub with regular entertainment. Part of the same complex, the Aparthotel Alto da Colina boasts a large pool, restaurant and tennis. The Pine Cliffs Resort is a luxurious property in a dramatic setting five miles from Albufeira, with its own golf course, hotel, tennis academy, six pools, spa and a lift down to the beach. Quinta do Lago is one of the Algarve’s prime addresses and is home to the Lakeside Country Club. Just three years old, it has an indoor pool, tennis and bike hire, while the apartments are stylish and spacious. The location is handy for visiting the local lakes and lagoons. Staying next to a marina gives a sense of living the high life, which is what’s on offer at the Marina Club Lagos Resort. The apartments are set around a delightful pool; there’s a restaurant on the quay and nautical-themed bar. The centre of Lagos is within walking distance and making the most of the sister hotel’s spa is also a must. Finally, Vilamoura is one of Europe’s homes of golf and the first-class Residences Victoria are set beside the Victoria course as well as being close to many other top venues. The apartments boast large terraces and stylish furnishings and share an indoor pool. Use of the sister hotel's spa is also a must!
